answer: I discovered that JavaScript's event loop is single-threaded but uses a callback queue to handle async operations. This completely changed my understanding of how setTimeout and promises work!
The most surprising thing was learning about CSS specificity rules. I couldn't figure out why my styles weren't applying until I understood how ID selectors override class selectors.
I was amazed to learn that React's virtual DOM uses a diffing algorithm to minimize actual DOM updates. This explains why React apps are so performant despite frequent re-renders!
I struggled with understanding promises until I learned about microtask queue. Now I know why promise callbacks run before setTimeout callbacks, even if setTimeout is called first!
My biggest challenge was debugging a memory leak in my React app. I learned that useEffect cleanup functions are crucial for removing event listeners and preventing memory issues.
I overcame my fear of algorithms by implementing a hash table from scratch. Understanding how collisions are resolved with chaining made data structures click for me!
I want to master Next.js next. I've already built a few React apps, and learning about server-side rendering and static generation seems like natural progression.
My next goal is to learn Docker and containerization. Understanding how to package applications consistently across different environments will make me a more versatile developer.
I'm focusing on GraphQL next. REST APIs are great, but GraphQL's ability to request exactly what you need and prevent over-fetching seems revolutionary for frontend development.
Learning about WebAssembly blew my mind! The fact that we can run languages like Rust and C++ directly in browser opens up so many possibilities for web development.
I discovered that CSS Grid and Flexbox work better together than separately. Using Grid for overall layout and Flexbox for component alignment has made my responsive designs so much cleaner!
The most surprising discovery was learning about browser's rendering pipeline. Understanding how CSS triggers layout, paint, and composite phases helped me optimize animations for 60fps performance!
I struggled with understanding Redux middleware until I built my own custom middleware. Seeing how actions flow through the chain made the concept click perfectly.
My breakthrough came when I learned about JavaScript's prototype chain. Understanding that objects are linked through prototypes rather than copied made inheritance finally make sense!
I overcame my confusion about async JavaScript by building a promise polyfill from scratch. Understanding the A+ specification and how promises resolve asynchronously was eye-opening!
